contentList.content: Severance

When you make an <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_UnarmedStrike_Monk">Unarmed Strike</LSTag> against an opponent, you may spend 3 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">Ki Points</LSTag> to leave them under the effects of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silence</LSTag> for 9 turns.
Roaring Palm
When using this action, the target must make a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Constitution Saving Throw</LSTag>. If it fails, it is knocked unconscious. If it succeeds, it takes [1].

Whenever you use an <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_UnarmedStrike_Monk">Unarmed Strike</LSTag> against an opponent, you may spend 6 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">Ki Points</LSTag> to spread a [1] radius of pure <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">silence</LSTag> centered around your target. In this area, sound will not travel, and any creature within the range cannot speak.
Moonlight Strike

When you make an <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_UnarmedStrike_Monk">Unarmed Strike</LSTag> against an opponent, it leaves them under the effects of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="LIGHT">Light</LSTag>.
Managing the Breath
Practitioners of the Way of Marshmerrow may utilize their <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">Ki Points</LSTag> to imitate some Illusion Spells.
Demoralizing Blow

When you make a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FlurryOfBlows">Flurry of Blows</LSTag> against an opponent, you may spend 1 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">Ki Points</LSTag> to leave the target under the effects of the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="CL_Target_DemoralizingTouch">Demoralizing Touch</LSTag> spell.

Your blow carries a frightening Aura. The target of your attack must make a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Constitution Saving Throw</LSTag> saving throw. If it fails, it is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">frightened</LSTag> for 6 turns.
Charming Blow

When you make a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FlurryOfBlows">Flurry of Blows</LSTag> against an opponent, you may spend 1 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">Ki Points</LSTag> to leave the target under the effects of the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="CL_Target_CharmingTouch">Charming Touch</LSTag> spell.

Your blow carries a frightening Aura. The target of your attack must make a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Constitution Saving Throw</LSTag> saving throw. If it fails, it is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">charmed</LSTag> for 6 turns.
Frenzying Blow

When you make a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FlurryOfBlows">Flurry of Blows</LSTag> against an opponent, you may spend 1 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">Ki Points</LSTag> to leave the target under the effects of the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="CL_Target_FrenzyingTouch">Frenzying Touch</LSTag> spell.

Your blow carries a frightening Aura. The target of your attack must make a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Constitution Saving Throw</LSTag> saving throw. If it fails, it is riled up into a <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRENZY">frenzy</LSTag> for 6 turns.
Step of the Wind: Eye-Maze

When you Disengage using <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Disengage_StepOfTheWind">Step of the Wind</LSTag>, you are granted the effects of the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="CL_Target_EyeMaze">Eye-Maze</LSTag> spell for 4 turns.
Step of the Wind: Muffle

When you Dash using <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Dash_StepOfTheWind">Step of the Wind</LSTag>, you are granted the effects of the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="CL_Target_Muffle">Muffle</LSTag> spell for 4 turns.
Vibrant Deflection

When you successfully <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Interrupt_DeflectMissiles">Deflect Missiles</LSTag>, your attacker is left under the effects of the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_ColorSpray">Color Spray</LSTag> spell.
Misdeflection

When you successfully <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Interrupt_DeflectMissiles">Deflect Missiles</LSTag>, your attacker is left under the effects of the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="CL_Target_MisdirectedMark">Misdirected Mark</LSTag> spell.
